title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Coerce to coordinate classes — as_coo
text: x object coerce.

title: Coerce to coordinate classes — as_coo
text: Object updated class attribute.

title: Coerce to coordinate classes — as_coo
text: Coordinate classes (inherit "coo"): as_coo(): generic coordinate object as_out(): outline (closed polygon) as_ldk(): landmarks as_cur(): curve (open outline) as_path(): path (open curve direction) as_opoly(): open polygon Non-coordinate classes: as_ldk_id(): landmark identifiers (inherits coo) Coefficient classes (inherit "coe"): as_coe(): generic coefficient object as_eft(): Elliptic Fourier Transform coefficients as_dct(): Discrete Cosine Transform coefficients as_proc(): Procrustes-aligned coefficients as_npoly(): nested polygon coefficients

title: Apply affine transformation — coo_affine
text: x matrix (nx2), list matrices, tibble coo columns. ... Additional arguments (reserved future use). .cols Column name(s) process x tibble. NULL, automatically detects columns containing coo objects. mat 2x2 numeric matrix defining affine transformation.

title: Apply affine transformation — coo_affine
text: x single matrix: returns transformed matrix x list: returns list transformed matrices x tibble: returns tibble specified coo columns transformed

title: Apply affine transformation — coo_affine
text: transformation applied : x_new = x %*% mat Common transformation matrices: Rotation angle θ: matrix(c(cos(θ), sin(θ), -sin(θ), cos(θ)), nrow = 2) Scaling sx, sy: matrix(c(sx, 0, 0, sy), nrow = 2) Shear x: matrix(c(1, 0, k, 1), nrow = 2)

title: Get circularity measures — get_circularity
text: Circularity measures: get_circularity(): Isoperimetric quotient = 4π × Area / Perimeter². Value 1 perfect circle, < 1 shapes. get_circularity_norm(): Normalized version = Area / (Perimeter²/(4π)). Alternative formulation, interpretation. get_circularity_haralick(): Mean(radii) / SD(radii) centroid. Higher values = circular. Sensitive irregularities. measures equal 1 perfect circles decrease shapes.

title: Measure shape properties — measure
text: Available measurements (require scalar-returning get_* functions): Size perimeter: "area" - polygon area (shoelace formula) "perim" - perimeter length Centroid size: "centroid_size" - centroid size (standard) "centroid_size_norm" - normalized centroid size Circularity: "circularity" - isoperimetric quotient (4πA/P²) "circularity_norm" - normalized circularity "circularity_haralick" - mean(radii)/sd(radii) centroid Length aspect ratio: "length" - range along major inertia axis "width" - range along minor inertia axis "elongation" - aspect ratio (length/width) "rectangularity" - area/(length×width) Convex hull measures: "convexity" - perim_hull/perim "solidity" - area/area_hull Complex shape descriptors: "rectilinearity" - rectangular fit optimal rotation "calliper" - maximum distance points see available measurements, use available_measures().
